S_integrator module¶

Module of various types of integrators

S_integrator.Boris_Magnetic_integrator(ptcls, params)[source]¶

Update particles’ positions and velocities using the Boris algorithm in the case of a constant magnetic field along the \(z\) axis. For more info see eqs. (80) - (81) of Ref. [1]_

Parameters

  • ptlcs (class) – Particles data. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more info.

Returns

U – Total potential energy.

Return type

float

References

1

Chin Phys Rev E 77, 066401 (2008)

class S_integrator.Integrator(params)[source]¶

Bases: object

Assign integrator type.

Parameters

  • params (class) –

  • parameters. (Simulation's) –

update¶

Integrator choice. ‘Verlet’ or ‘Magnetic_Verlet’.

Type

func

RK(ptcls)[source]¶

Update particle position and velocity based on the 4th order Runge-Kutta method More information can be found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge–Kutta_methods or on the Sarkas website.

Parameters

  • ptlcs (particles data. See S_particles.py for the detailed information) –

  • k1 (the vel, acc at the beginng) –

  • k2 (the vel, acc at the middle) –

  • k3 (the vel, acc at the middle if the acc. at the beginning was k2) –

  • k4 (the vel, acc at the end if the acc. at the beginning was k3) –

Returns

U – Total potential energy

Return type

float

RK45(ptcls)[source]¶

Update particle position and velocity based on Explicit Runge-Kutta method of order 5(4). More information can be found here: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.RK45.html https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge–Kutta_methods or on the Sarkas website.

Parameters

ptlcs (class) – Particles data. See S_particles.py for the detailed information

Returns

U – Total potential energy

Return type

float

RK45_with_Langevin(ptcls)[source]¶
S_integrator.Magnetic_integrator(ptcls, params)[source]¶

Update particles’ positions and velocities based on velocity verlet method in the case of a constant magnetic field along the \(z\) axis. For more info see eq. (78) of Ref. [1]_

Parameters

  • ptlcs (class) – Particles data. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more info.

Returns

U – Total potential energy.

Return type

float

References

1

Chin Phys Rev E 77, 066401 (2008)

S_integrator.Verlet(ptcls, params)[source]¶

Update particle position and velocity based on velocity verlet method. More information can be found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verlet_integration or on the Sarkas website.

Parameters

  • ptcls (class) – Particles data. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more info.

Returns

U – Total potential energy

Return type

float

S_integrator.Verlet_with_Langevin(ptcls, params)[source]¶

Calculate particles dynamics using the Velocity Verlet algorithm and Langevin damping.

Parameters

  • ptlcs (class) – Particles data. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more info.

Returns

U – Total potential energy

Return type

float

S_integrator.calc_dipole(pos, charge)[source]¶

Calculate the dipole due to all charges. See Ref. 2 for explanation.

Parameters

  • pos (array) – Particles’ positions. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • charge (array) – Array containing the charge of each particle. See S_particles.py for more info.

Returns

dipole – Net dipole

Return type

array

References

2

J-M. Caillol, J Chem Phys 101 6080 (1994)

S_integrator.calc_pot_acc(ptcls, params)[source]¶

Calculate the Potential and update particles’ accelerations.

Parameters

  • ptcls (class) – Particles’ data. See S_particles.py for more information.

  • params (class) – Simulation’s parameters. See S_params.py for more information.

Returns

U – Total Potential.

Return type

float

S_integrator.enforce_pbc(pos, cntr, BoxVector)[source]¶

Enforce Periodic Boundary conditions.

Parameters

  • pos (array) – particles’ positions. See S_particles.py for more info.

  • cntr (array) – Counter for the number of times each particle get folded back into the main simulation box

  • BoxVector (array) – Box Dimensions.
